title: UNLIMEAT: "It’s the Perfect Time to Enhance the ‘Deliciousness’ of Alternative Meat" - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: UNLIMEAT, a South Korean company, is using upcycled ingredients to create plant-based meat products that are tailored for diverse global cuisines. The company's mission is to reduce food waste and promote plant-based eating. UNLIMEAT's products are currently available in over 1,300 retail stores across the United States, including Albertsons, Berkeley Bowl, Mollie Stone’s Market, Lassens in California, and Good Earth Market in Utah.
green_innovation: TRUE, UNLIMEAT's plant-based meat products are designed to reduce food waste and promote plant-based eating.
business_innovation: TRUE, UNLIMEAT's plant-based meat products are new and improved products that differ significantly from the firm's previous products.
green_product: TRUE, UNLIMEAT's plant-based meat products are designed to reduce environmental impact by using upcycled ingredients and promoting plant-based eating.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green process.

greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not describe an example of greenwashing.

title: Fresh Thyme Market Reveals Inaugural Top Ten Food Trends for 2024 - PR Newswire
summary: Fresh Thyme Market, a Midwest grocer, has released its first trends report focusing on Midwest shopping habits and brands. The report offers 10 insights into emerging trends that shoppers can expect to see in each aisle of the store next year.
greenwashing: There is no evidence of greenwashing in this article.

title: The plastipelago - New Mandala
summary: The article discusses the concept of a circular economy and its potential to address waste management challenges in Indonesia. The author argues that while waste can be seen as both a problem and an opportunity, the circular economy approach has limitations and may not fully address the issue of waste pollution. The article also highlights the challenges of turning plastic waste into new products of economic value and the need to recognize and acknowledge the importance of social justice and equity in waste management transformations.

title: Brushes with purpose: Kohl Kreatives eyes growth potential among India's eco-conscious beauty consumers - CosmeticsDesign-Asia.com
summary: Kohl Kreatives is a British sustainable beauty brand that recently entered the Indian market through a partnership with beauty e-commerce platform, Kult App. The brand observed a demand for sustainable and inclusive products among younger Indian consumers. According to its founder, Indian consumers are slowly realizing the impact of sustainability on product pricing, but are willing to pay a premium if they understand the added value.
